result.execSummary:
The defendant Torrion R Spivey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
---------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
---------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
---------------------------

records.addlTxt: Temporary Commitment form filed

8:36 am  Court in session.  Case called.  
ADA Andrew R. Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Torrion R Spivey in court, in custody with attorney James E Goldmann.  
Matter is before the court for sentencing after revocation.  
Court has reviewed the file including the Revocation Order and Warrant and the Revocation Summary.  
Atty Herrmann indicates his office did not get a copy of the revocation paperwork and he was just assigned to this case on a last minute basis.  Court notes this is DA Necci's case.  Atty Herrmann advises that DA Necci is currently in drug court staffings.  Atty Herrmann says he was not originally assigned to this case.  Court provides Atty Herrmann with a copy of the revocation summary for his review and asks Clerk to send email to Drug Court staffings requesting that DA Necci come up to the courtroom.   
8:43 am  Court in recess.  
8:50 am  Court in session with same appearances.  
Atty Herrmann has had a chance to review the revocation summary.  Atty Herrmann agrees with revocation summary.  He does not believe that "time served" is appropriate.  
Court notes the maximum sentence here would be 6 months.  
8:51 am  Argument by Atty Goldmann.  
8:54 am  Statement by Defendant.  Response by Deft to Court's questions.  
8:55 am  Court makes record and sentences the defendant to 127 days in jail - "time served."  Court orders entry of a civil judgment for any unpaid court obligations.  
8:58 am  Court in recess.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Torrion R Spivey in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock for Julia May.  Estee Elizabeth Scholtz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money
Signed bond filed with the court.
Defendant in court in custody with attorney Julia May for bond purposes only. Diane Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.

MUST POST $1000.00 CASH. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S):NO CONTACT WITH J.E. AND C.P.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
